Class Metrics

Configures its View's measurement unit and mapping between the Real-space and World-space 3D Cartesian coordinate systems.

Summary
  • Located at View.metrics.
  • Metrics.units configures the Real-space unit type, which is {@link MetersUnit} by default.
  • Metrics.scale configures the number of Real-space units represented by each unit within the World-space 3D coordinate system. This is 1.0 by default.
  • Metrics.origin configures the 3D Real-space origin, in current Real-space units, at which this View's World-space coordinate origin sits, This is [0,0,0] by default.

Usage

 
import {WebViewer, constants} from "xeokit-viewer.es.js";

const viewer = new WebViewer();

const view1 = myViewer.createView({
     id: "myView",
     canvasId: "myCanvas1"
});

const metrics = view1.metrics;

metrics.units = constants.MetersUnit;
metrics.scale = 10.0;
metrics.origin = [100.0, 0.0, 200.0];

scale

  • get scale(): number
  • set scale(value: number): void
    • Defined in webviewer/src/viewer/view/Metriqs.ts:182

    Gets the number of Real-space units represented by each unit of the View's World-space coordinate system.

    Returns number

    • Defined in webviewer/src/viewer/view/Metriqs.ts:191

    Sets the number of Real-space units represented by each unit of the View's World-space coordinate system.

    For example, if Metrics.units is {@link MetersUnit}, and there are ten meters per World-space coordinate system unit, then scale would have a value of 10.0.

    Parameters

    • value: number

    Returns void

units

  • get units(): number
  • set units(value: number): void
    • Defined in webviewer/src/viewer/view/Metriqs.ts:156

    Gets the View's Real-space unit type.

    Returns number

    • Defined in webviewer/src/viewer/view/Metriqs.ts:165

    Sets the View's Real-space unit type.

    Accepted values are {@link MetersUnit}, {@link CentimetersUnit}, {@link MillimetersUnit}, {@link YardsUnit}, {@link FeetUnit} and {@link InchesUnit}.

    Parameters

    • value: number

    Returns void

unitsInfo

  • get unitsInfo(): {}
    • Defined in webviewer/src/viewer/view/Metriqs.ts:149

    Gets info about the supported Real-space unit types.

    With {@link constants} indicating each unit type, the info will be:

    {
    [constants.MetersUnit]: {
        abbrev: "m"
    },
    [constants.CentimetersUnit]: {
        abbrev: "cm"
    },
    [constants.MillimetersUnit]: {
        abbrev: "mm"
    },
    [constants.YardsUnit]: {
        abbrev: "yd"
    },
    [constants.FeetUnit]: {
        abbrev: "ft"
    },
    [constants.InchesUnit]: {
        abbrev: "in"
    }
}

    Returns {}

  • Inherited from Component.error

    Logs an error for this component to the JavaScript console.

    The console message will have this format: [ERROR] [<component type> =<component id>: <message>

    Also fires the message as an "error" event on the WebViewer.

realToWorldPos

  • realToWorldPos(realPos: FloatArrayParam, worldPos?: FloatArrayParam): FloatArrayParam
    • Defined in webviewer/src/viewer/view/Metriqs.ts:249

    Converts a 3D position from Real-space to World-space.

    This is equivalent to worldPos = (worldPos - #origin) / #scale.

    Parameters

    • realPos: FloatArrayParam

      Real-space 3D position.

    • worldPos: FloatArrayParam = ...

    Returns FloatArrayParam

    World-space 3D position.

worldToRealPos

  • worldToRealPos(worldPos: FloatArrayParam, realPos?: FloatArrayParam): FloatArrayParam
    • Defined in webviewer/src/viewer/view/Metriqs.ts:233

    Converts a 3D position from World-space to Real-space.

    This is equivalent to realPos = #origin + (worldPos * #scale).

    Parameters

    • worldPos: FloatArrayParam

      World-space 3D position, in World coordinate system units.

    • realPos: FloatArrayParam = ...

    Returns FloatArrayParam

    Real-space 3D position, in units indicated by {@link Metrics#units}.
